lim1.title: Limit 1
lim1.description: True if configured limit 1 is exceeded

lim3.title: Limit 3
lim3.description: True if configured limit 3 is exceeded

SRSSI1.title: Sonic Received Signal Strength Indicator 1
SRSSI1.description: The SRSSI is simply an integer number between 1 (low level) and 10 (expected level) given to the expected strength of the echo reflected to the transducer.

SRSSI2.title: Sonic Received Signal Strength Indicator 2
SRSSI2.description: The SRSSI is simply an integer number between 1 (low level) and 10 (expected level) given to the expected strength of the echo reflected to the transducer.

SRSSI3.title: Sonic Received Signal Strength Indicator 3
SRSSI3.description: The SRSSI is simply an integer number between 1 (low level) and 10 (expected level) given to the expected strength of the echo reflected to the transducer.

SRSSI4.title: Sonic Received Signal Strength Indicator 4
SRSSI4.description: The SRSSI is simply an integer number between 1 (low level) and 10 (expected level) given to the expected strength of the echo reflected to the transducer.

SRC1.title: Sonic Results Code 1 – a performance metric of the ultrasonic measurement
SRC1.description: The SRC represents the result code of the ultrasonic algorithm which can be used to deduce whether a reading is likely to be valid or not. An SRC of 9 or 10 are optimal.

SRC2.title: Sonic Results Code 2 – a performance metric of the ultrasonic measurement
SRC2.description: The SRC represents the result code of the ultrasonic algorithm which can be used to deduce whether a reading is likely to be valid or not. An SRC of 9 or 10 are optimal.
